snippet: In the first local elections since 1976 in Hebron, a conservative West Bank city, Maysoun Qawasmi is leading a slate of candidates who she says are better off heard than seen.
abstract: Memo From The West Bank; group of 11 women running for office in West Bank town of Hebron are first all-female list of candidates in Palestinian territories; elections, first in six years, are much-needed opportunity for political expression, despite interference from Hamas and Fatah.
lead_paragraph: In the first local elections since 1976 in Hebron, a conservative West Bank city, Maysoun Qawasmi is leading a slate of candidates who she says are better off heard than seen.

headline.seo: All-Female Ticket, a First in Palestinian Territories, Campaigns in Hebron
headline.main: All-Female Ticket Aims to Be Heard, if Not Seen
headline.print_headline: All-Female Ticket Aims to Be Heard, if Not Seen
